title: General (Improvement)
summary: Organizations must identify opportunities for improvement and take actions to enhance QMS performance and customer satisfaction.
requirements: Determine and select improvement opportunities across all QMS processes.
Implement actions that improve product quality, processes, customer satisfaction, and overall system effectiveness.
Use data analysis, audits, customer feedback, and performance results to drive improvements.
evidence_examples: Analysis of trends and corrective actions
auditor_questions: How does your organization identify improvement opportunities?
Show evidence of actions taken to improve QMS performance.
How are improvement initiatives tracked?
risks_if_not_compliant: Stagnation or decline in quality performance
checklist: Is data used to identify improvement areas?

title: Nonconformity and corrective action
summary: Organizations must take action when nonconformities occur, prevent recurrence, and maintain records of corrective actions.
requirements: React to nonconformities and control them.
Evaluate the cause of the nonconformity.
Implement corrective actions appropriate to the effects of the nonconformity.
Review effectiveness of corrective actions.
Update risks, opportunities, documents, and controls as needed.
Retain documented evidence of corrective actions.
evidence_examples: Root cause analysis forms (5 Why, Fishbone, etc.)
auditor_questions: Show a recent nonconformity and corrective action.
How do you analyze root causes?
How do you verify effectiveness of corrective actions?
risks_if_not_compliant: Increased customer complaints or product returns
checklist: Are corrective actions implemented and closed?

title: Continual improvement
summary: Organizations must continually improve the suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness of the QMS.
requirements: Promote a culture of ongoing improvement across all levels.
Use outputs from audits, performance data, customer feedback, risks, opportunities, and management review for improvement.
Implement structured improvement initiatives with measurable outcomes.
Monitor improvement actions for effectiveness.
auditor_questions: Give examples of continual improvements implemented recently.
How do you evaluate effectiveness of improvement actions?
How does management promote continual improvement?
checklist: Is data used to identify improvement opportunities?

title: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
summary: Organizations must monitor, measure, analyze, and evaluate QMS performance, including customer satisfaction and process effectiveness.
requirements: Identify what needs to be monitored and measured (KPIs, processes, products).
Define methods, frequency, responsibilities, and criteria for evaluation.
Collect and analyze data for QMS effectiveness and improvement.
Monitor customer satisfaction using appropriate methods.
Document and retain records of monitoring and measurement results.
auditor_questions: What KPIs do you monitor for QMS performance?
How do you measure customer satisfaction?
Show records of data analysis and actions taken.
risks_if_not_compliant: Unidentified trends leading to quality failures

title: Internal audit
summary: Organizations must conduct internal audits at planned intervals to ensure the QMS conforms to ISO 9001 and internal requirements.
requirements: Prepare an audit program considering process importance, results, and past issues.
Define audit criteria and scope.
Select competent auditors ensuring objectivity.
Report audit findings and take action on nonconformities.
Retain records of audit execution and follow-up.
auditor_questions: Show your audit schedule.
How do you ensure auditor independence?
Show evidence of corrective actions from audits.
checklist: Are audits conducted as per plan?

title: Management review
summary: Top management must review the QMS at planned intervals to ensure ongoing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.
requirements: Plan management reviews at defined intervals.
Review QMS performance, customer satisfaction, audit results, risks, opportunities, objectives, and resources.
Document decisions and actions for improvement.
Ensure outputs include resource needs, improvement actions, and QMS changes.
evidence_examples: Action plans with owners and deadlines
auditor_questions: When was the last management review conducted?
Show evidence of decisions and assigned actions.
How does management review contribute to QMS improvement?
risks_if_not_compliant: Lack of direction for the QMS
checklist: Are action items tracked to closure?

title: Production and service provision
summary: Organizations must carry out production and service activities under controlled conditions to ensure conformity.
requirements: Provide documented procedures, work instructions, and reference materials as needed.
Use suitable equipment and maintain controlled environments.
Deploy competent personnel and validate special processes.
Implement identification and traceability where required.
Protect customer or supplier property.
Preserve products during internal processing and delivery.
auditor_questions: How do you ensure production/service activities are controlled?
How do you maintain traceability?
Show records of preservation or handling of products.
risks_if_not_compliant: Loss of traceability and uncontrolled outputs

title: Release of products and services
summary: Products and services must be verified and approved before release to the customer.
requirements: Define acceptance criteria for product/service release.
Perform inspections, tests, or reviews before delivery.
Ensure authorized personnel approve release.
Maintain records of acceptance and release decisions.
auditor_questions: How do you verify products/services before release?
Show your acceptance criteria.
Who authorizes release?

ISO_45001: Control of Outputs That Affect Safety

checklist: Are only authorized personnel approving release?

title: Control of nonconforming outputs
summary: Organizations must identify, control, and prevent unintended use or delivery of nonconforming products or services.
requirements: Identify and segregate nonconforming outputs immediately.
Define actions such as rework, repair, concession, or scrap.
Obtain customer approval for concessions where needed.
Record details of nonconformities, actions taken, and authorization.
Prevent recurrence by analyzing trends and taking corrective action.
auditor_questions: How do you identify and control nonconforming outputs?
Show records of rework or concessions.
How are nonconformities analyzed for recurrence?
risks_if_not_compliant: Financial loss due to rework or returns
checklist: Are concessions approved by customers when needed?

title: Operational planning and control
summary: Organizations must plan, implement, and control the processes needed to meet product/service requirements.
requirements: Plan operations to meet quality requirements and customer expectations.
Control processes through defined criteria, instructions, and monitoring.
Manage outsourced processes to ensure conformity.
Maintain documented information showing operations are performed as planned.
auditor_questions: How do you ensure operations are controlled?
Show the criteria for process acceptance.
How do you manage outsourced operations?

title: Requirements for products and services
summary: Organizations must ensure customer requirements for products and services are clearly understood and agreed before committing to supply.
requirements: Define requirements specified by the customer and those not stated but necessary for intended use.
Confirm requirements before accepting orders.
Maintain records of contract/order reviews.
Ensure communication with customers regarding enquiries, changes, complaints, and feedback.
auditor_questions: How do you review customer requirements?
Show evidence of contract/order confirmation.
How do you manage customer communication?

title: Design and development of products and services
summary: Organizations must establish a structured design and development process when applicable.
requirements: Plan design stages, responsibilities, and review checkpoints.
Define inputs including customer expectations, regulatory needs, and past data.
Ensure design outputs meet input requirements.
Conduct verification and validation.
Control design changes through review and approval.
auditor_questions: How do you plan your design stages?
Show evidence of design verification.
How are design changes controlled?
risks_if_not_compliant: Product failures due to incomplete design

title: Control of externally provided processes, products and services
summary: Organizations must ensure suppliers and outsourced processes meet defined requirements.
requirements: Evaluate and select suppliers based on ability to meet requirements.
Define criteria for supplier approval and ongoing monitoring.
Communicate requirements clearly to suppliers.
Inspect or verify externally provided products/services.
Maintain control over outsourced processes.
auditor_questions: How do you select and evaluate suppliers?
Show supplier performance monitoring records.
How do you ensure outsourced processes remain controlled?

title: Awareness
summary: Employees must be aware of the quality policy, quality objectives, their roles, and the impact of not conforming to QMS requirements.
requirements: Ensure staff understand the quality policy and their role in achieving objectives.
Communicate the importance of conforming to QMS requirements.
Ensure employees are aware of how their work affects product/service quality.
auditor_questions: How do employees learn about their impact on quality?
How do you ensure awareness of the quality policy?
Show evidence of awareness training.
risks_if_not_compliant: Employee mistakes due to lack of understanding
checklist: Do employees know the quality policy?

title: Communication
summary: Organizations must establish internal and external communication processes relevant to the QMS.
requirements: Determine what needs to be communicated, when, and to whom.
Define communication methods (meetings, emails, reports, notices).
Ensure communication is clear, timely, and appropriate.
Document communication responsibilities where needed.
auditor_questions: How do you communicate quality-related information?
Show evidence of internal QMS communication.
How do you communicate with customers and suppliers?
checklist: Is there a QMS communication process?

title: Documented information
summary: QMS documents and records must be controlled to ensure availability, proper use, and protection from loss or unauthorized changes.
requirements: Maintain documented information required by the QMS and ISO 9001.
Control creation, approval, updating, and storage of documents.
Ensure records are protected from loss, tampering, and unauthorized access.
Ensure documents are available where needed and obsolete versions are removed.
auditor_questions: Show how you control QMS documents.
How do you manage obsolete documents?
Where is documented information stored and protected?
risks_if_not_compliant: Use of outdated or incorrect documents
checklist: Is there a document control procedure?

title: General (Resources)
summary: The organization must identify and provide all resources needed for the QMS to function effectively.
requirements: Determine resource needs for processes, people, equipment, environment, and technology.
Ensure resources are adequate, available, and maintained.
Plan resources during organizational or process changes.
auditor_questions: How do you determine resource needs?
Are resources reassessed during changes?
Show evidence of resource adequacy.
risks_if_not_compliant: Process failures due to insufficient resources

title: People
summary: The organization must ensure enough competent personnel are available to run QMS processes effectively.
requirements: Determine required personnel and competencies for each process.
Ensure adequate staffing in all operational areas.
Verify that staff are competent or trained to become competent.
auditor_questions: How do you determine if you have enough staff?
Show the competency requirements for key roles.
How do you address competency gaps?
risks_if_not_compliant: Process delays or failures due to manpower shortage
Incorrect or inconsistent outputs from untrained staff

title: Infrastructure
summary: Provide and maintain infrastructure required for processes including buildings, equipment, utilities, and IT systems.
requirements: Identify infrastructure needs for all QMS processes.
Ensure equipment, buildings, and utilities are maintained.
Plan upgrades or replacements before failures occur.
auditor_questions: What infrastructure is critical to product quality?
Show maintenance records for key equipment.
How do you ensure uninterrupted utilities?
risks_if_not_compliant: Quality issues from poorly maintained equipment
checklist: Is there a backup plan for critical utilities?

title: Environment for the operation of processes
summary: Provide a suitable environment (physical, social, psychological) to ensure process performance and product quality.
requirements: Identify environmental conditions that affect product/service quality.
Control temperature, humidity, lighting, noise, cleanliness, and safety.
Maintain a positive working environment including human behavior factors.
auditor_questions: What environmental conditions affect product quality?
Show monitoring records for controlled environments.
How do you ensure a safe and hygienic workspace?

title: Monitoring and measuring resources
summary: Ensure that equipment used to monitor or measure quality is suitable, calibrated, and maintained.
requirements: Identify equipment affecting measurement accuracy.
Calibrate equipment at defined intervals.
Maintain calibration/verification records.
Take action when equipment is found out of calibration.
auditor_questions: Which instruments are used for quality measurement?
Show calibration records.
What happens when equipment fails calibration?

title: Organizational knowledge
summary: Maintain and make available the knowledge needed to operate processes and deliver conforming products/services.
requirements: Identify critical knowledge areas (process, technical, experiential).
Capture and document knowledge when employees leave or processes change.
Ensure knowledge is available to relevant personnel.
Promote continuous learning and update knowledge repositories.
auditor_questions: How do you identify essential organizational knowledge?
Where is knowledge stored?
How do you prevent knowledge loss?
risks_if_not_compliant: Loss of key knowledge due to staff attrition
checklist: Is access given to relevant staff?

title: Competence
summary: Personnel performing work affecting quality must be competent based on education, training, or experience.
requirements: Identify competency requirements for each role.
Assess employees against these criteria.
Provide training or mentoring where gaps exist.
Maintain records of training and competency evaluations.
auditor_questions: How do you determine competency needs?
Show training records for key operators.
How are competency gaps addressed?
risks_if_not_compliant: Process errors due to untrained personnel

title: Quality objectives and planning to achieve them
summary: Organizations must establish measurable quality objectives and plan how to achieve them.
requirements: Define measurable quality objectives aligned to the quality policy.
Ensure objectives are relevant to product/service conformity and customer satisfaction.
Plan actions, responsible persons, timelines, and resources required to meet each objective.
Review progress periodically and update as needed.
evidence_examples: KPI dashboards showing target vs actual
Meeting minutes showing review of objectives
auditor_questions: What are your current quality objectives?
How are objectives measured and monitored?
Show evidence of progress review.
risks_if_not_compliant: Lack of direction for quality improvements
Objectives not aligned with strategic priorities

title: Planning for changes
summary: Changes to the QMS must be planned in a controlled manner to ensure integrity and continued performance.
requirements: Identify changes that impact the QMS (process, equipment, staff, systems).
Assess potential consequences and risks before implementing changes.
Assign responsibilities, resources, and timelines for changes.
Ensure QMS continues to function effectively during and after the change.
evidence_examples: Records of approvals for process or technology changes
auditor_questions: How do you evaluate risks before implementing changes?
Show an example of a planned change and approval document.
How do you ensure QMS integrity during changes?
risks_if_not_compliant: Uncontrolled changes leading to quality failures

title: Resources
summary: The organization must determine and provide resources needed to establish, implement, maintain, and improve the QMS.
requirements: Determine resource needs including personnel, infrastructure, and environment.
Provide adequate training, tools, and monitoring equipment.
Ensure resources are maintained and evaluated for suitability.
Plan resources during new projects, changes, or expansions.
auditor_questions: How are resource needs identified?
Show evidence of resource adequacy (staff, equipment, tools).
How is monitoring/measuring equipment maintained?
risks_if_not_compliant: Poor product quality due to inadequate equipment

title: Quality policy
summary: Top management must establish, maintain, and communicate a quality policy aligned with the organization’s purpose and commitment to meeting requirements.
requirements: Document a quality policy that supports the organization’s direction.
Ensure the policy includes commitment to meeting requirements and improving the QMS.
Communicate the policy to all staff and make it available to relevant interested parties.
Review the policy periodically for ongoing relevance.
evidence_examples: Approved quality policy signed by top management
Email or poster communication of the policy
Minutes showing periodic review of the policy
auditor_questions: Where is your quality policy documented?
How is the policy communicated to staff?
How does the policy support strategic direction?
risks_if_not_compliant: Misalignment between operations and quality goals
checklist: Does it include commitment to improvement?

title: Organizational roles, responsibilities and authorities
summary: Top management must assign and communicate roles and responsibilities to ensure the QMS is effective.
requirements: Define roles and responsibilities related to QMS performance.
Communicate responsibilities to relevant personnel.
Ensure process owners have authority to carry out duties.
Document responsibilities in job descriptions or matrices.
auditor_questions: Who is responsible for QMS implementation?
Show how responsibilities are communicated.
How is accountability ensured?
risks_if_not_compliant: Lack of accountability for QMS performance
checklist: Do employees know their QMS roles?

title: Actions to address risks and opportunities
summary: Organizations must identify risks and opportunities that impact QMS performance and plan actions accordingly.
requirements: Determine risks and opportunities related to QMS results and customer satisfaction.
Plan actions to address risks and enhance opportunities.
Integrate actions into operational processes and evaluate effectiveness.
Regularly review risks and update controls.
evidence_examples: Risk register with scoring and mitigation actions
Management review notes showing risk discussion
auditor_questions: How do you identify and assess QMS risks?
Show your risk register.
How are actions tracked and verified?

title: Understanding the organization and its context
summary: Identify internal and external factors that affect the Quality Management System.
requirements: Determine internal issues that affect quality performance.
Identify external issues including regulatory, social, technological, and market factors.
Review the context periodically and update when changes occur.
auditor_questions: How do you identify internal and external issues?
Show your latest context analysis.
How often is the context reviewed?
risks_if_not_compliant: Misalignment between operations and customer expectations
checklist: Is the context linked to risk assessment?

title: Understanding the needs and expectations of interested parties
summary: Identify stakeholders relevant to the QMS and understand their requirements.
requirements: List all interested parties impacting product/service quality.
Document their needs, expectations, and compliance obligations.
Review and update when stakeholder requirements change.
auditor_questions: Who are your key stakeholders?
Show how their requirements are included in QMS controls.
How do you track changes in stakeholder expectations?
checklist: Are requirements mapped to QMS controls?

title: Determining the scope of the QMS
summary: Define the boundaries and applicability of the Quality Management System.
requirements: Document the QMS scope, including products, services, and sites.
State exclusions with justification.
Ensure scope aligns with internal/external issues and stakeholder expectations.
auditor_questions: Where is the QMS scope documented?
What exclusions exist and why?
How did you decide the scope boundaries?
risks_if_not_compliant: Audit findings due to unjustified exclusions
checklist: Is scope aligned with context and stakeholders?

title: Quality Management System and its processes
summary: Define, implement, maintain, and improve processes needed for the QMS.
requirements: Identify QMS processes, inputs, outputs, criteria, and interactions.
Assign process owners and performance indicators.
Implement monitoring, measurement, and continual improvement.
auditor_questions: Show your process map.
How do you monitor process performance?
Who owns each QMS process?
risks_if_not_compliant: Process failures leading to inconsistent output

title: Leadership and commitment
summary: Top management must demonstrate leadership and commitment to the QMS.
requirements: Ensure QMS effectiveness and integration into operations.
Communicate quality importance and support process owners.
Promote customer focus and continual improvement.
auditor_questions: How does top management show leadership?
Provide evidence of resource support.
How is customer focus demonstrated?
